title: Fexillon
description: A comprehensive UX strategy and design system for a leading enterprise software platform, focusing on user-centered design principles and scalable component architecture.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Fexillon required a complete overhaul of their enterprise platform's user experience. The existing interface was cluttered, inconsistent, and failing to meet the needs of their growing user base. I was brought in to lead the UX strategy from discovery through to delivery.

sections.title: Challenges
sections.content: The primary challenges included legacy system constraints, multiple stakeholder groups with competing priorities, and a tight timeline for delivery. The platform served over 10,000 daily active users across different roles and skill levels.

sections.title: Approach
sections.content: I began with extensive user research, conducting interviews with 30+ users across different roles. This informed the creation of detailed personas and journey maps. From there, I developed a comprehensive design system that could scale across the entire platform.

sections.title: Findings
sections.content: Research revealed that users were spending 40% more time than necessary on core tasks due to poor information architecture. Navigation patterns were inconsistent, and critical features were buried under multiple layers of menus.

sections.title: Recommendations
sections.content: I recommended a simplified navigation structure, role-based dashboards, and a consistent component library. The new design system included over 60 components with detailed documentation and usage guidelines.

sections.title: Final Thoughts
sections.content: The redesigned platform saw a 35% reduction in task completion time and a significant improvement in user satisfaction scores. The design system continues to serve as the foundation for all new feature development.

title: Blue Prism
description: Redesigning the user experience for Blue Prism's intelligent automation platform, creating intuitive workflows for complex robotic process automation tasks.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Blue Prism is a global leader in intelligent automation. They needed to simplify their complex platform interface to make robotic process automation accessible to a wider audience of business users.

sections.title: Challenges
sections.content: The platform's complexity was a barrier to adoption. Non-technical users struggled with the interface, and even experienced users found certain workflows unnecessarily complicated.

sections.title: Approach
sections.content: Through contextual inquiry and usability testing, I identified key pain points and developed a progressive disclosure model that revealed complexity only when needed. The new interface guides users through automation creation step by step.

sections.title: Final Thoughts
sections.content: The simplified interface led to a 50% increase in user adoption among non-technical staff and reduced onboarding time from weeks to days.

title: Wall Beard
description: Complete brand identity and digital presence for an artisan beard care company, from logo design through to e-commerce experience.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Wall Beard is a premium artisan beard care brand that needed a complete visual identity and e-commerce platform that reflected their commitment to quality and craftsmanship.

sections.title: Approach
sections.content: I developed a brand identity that combined rugged masculinity with refined sophistication. The visual language included custom typography, a warm color palette, and hand-drawn illustrations that conveyed the artisanal nature of the products.

sections.title: Final Thoughts
sections.content: The new brand identity and e-commerce platform helped Wall Beard establish a strong market presence, with online sales increasing by 200% in the first quarter after launch.

title: Capcom / Catie
description: Strategic UX consultation for Capcom's digital experiences, focusing on player engagement and community-driven design approaches.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Working with Capcom on their community engagement platform, I helped bridge the gap between player expectations and digital experience delivery.

sections.title: Challenges
sections.content: Gaming communities are passionate and vocal. The challenge was creating an experience that served both casual fans and hardcore enthusiasts while maintaining Capcom's brand standards.

sections.title: Approach
sections.content: I conducted extensive community research, analyzing forum discussions, social media sentiment, and player behavior data. This informed a user-centered strategy that prioritized community engagement features.

sections.title: Final Thoughts
sections.content: The strategy resulted in a 60% increase in community engagement metrics and established a framework for ongoing player-centered design decisions.

title: Forlorn Hope
description: Immersive digital experience design for an independent craft brewery, blending storytelling with e-commerce functionality.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Forlorn Hope is a craft brewery with a rich narrative behind every brew. They needed a digital experience that told their story while making it easy for customers to discover and purchase their products.

sections.title: Approach
sections.content: I designed an immersive scrolling experience that wove the brewery's narrative through the product catalog. Each beer had its own story page with custom illustrations and tasting notes.

sections.title: Final Thoughts
sections.content: The new website became a talking point in the craft beer community, driving a 150% increase in direct-to-consumer sales and earning recognition in several design publications.

title: XPod
description: End-to-end product design for a next-generation podcast platform, from concept through to launch-ready prototype.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: XPod set out to create a podcast platform that prioritized discovery and social features. I led the product design from initial concept through to a fully functional prototype.

sections.title: Challenges
sections.content: The podcast market is crowded with established players. XPod needed to differentiate through superior user experience and unique social features that existing platforms lacked.

sections.title: Approach
sections.content: I designed a discovery-first experience with AI-powered recommendations, social listening groups, and interactive episode annotations. The interface was designed to be instantly familiar while introducing novel interaction patterns.

sections.title: Final Thoughts
sections.content: The prototype tested exceptionally well in user sessions, with participants rating the discovery experience significantly higher than existing platforms. XPod secured seed funding based on the strength of the prototype.
